001package imagingbook.violajones.lib;
002
003import ij.process.FloatProcessor;
004import imagingbook.common.color.edge.CannyEdgeDetector;
005import imagingbook.common.color.edge.CannyEdgeDetector.Parameters;
006import imagingbook.common.image.IntegralImage;
007
008/**
009 * Used to calculate the gradient magnitude inside a given rectangular region.
010 * TODO: make more efficient
011 * 
012 * @author W. Burger
013 *
014 */
015public class Gradient {
016        
017        protected static IntegralImage makeGradientIntegral(int[][] I, double sigma) {
018                
019                Parameters params = new Parameters();
020                params.gSigma = sigma;
021                params.normGradMag = false;
022
023                CannyEdgeDetector detector = new CannyEdgeDetector(new FloatProcessor(I), params);
024                FloatProcessor Em = detector.getEdgeMagnitude();
025                
026//              Em.resetMinAndMax();
027//              new ImagePlus("Em", Em).show();
028                
029                int w = Em.getWidth();
030                int h = Em.getHeight();
031                
032                int[][] emi = new int[w][h];
033                for (int v = 0; v < h; v++) {
034                        for (int u = 0; u < w; u++) {
035                                emi[u][v] = (int) Em.getf(u, v);
036                        }
037                }
038                return new IntegralImage(emi);
039        }
040        
041}
